intro: Goldmanella, commonly known as the golden bellvista, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, dark green leaves and produces a milky sap that is toxic to animals. Goldmanella thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
